cessda.CdcPublisherNames.name: CDC Publisher Names
cessda.CdcPublisherNames.description: Names of organisations providing metadata for CESSDA Data Catalogue.

cessda:CdcPublisherNames.v2.name: CDC Publisher Names
cessda:CdcPublisherNames.v2.description: Names of organisations providing metadata for CESSDA Data Catalogue.

cessda.CessdaPersistentIdentifierTypes.name: CESSDA Persistent Identifier Types
cessda.CessdaPersistentIdentifierTypes.description: Lists the types of persistent identifiers that CESSDA accepts as study level PIDs in its data catalogue.

cessda:CessdaPersistentIdentifierTypes.v.name: CESSDA Persistent Identifier Types
cessda:CessdaPersistentIdentifierTypes.v.description: Lists the types of persistent identifiers that CESSDA accepts as study level PIDs in its data catalogue.

cessda.CountryNamesAndCodes.name: Country Names and Codes
cessda.CountryNamesAndCodes.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes and names.

cessda:CountryNamesAndCodes.v2.name: Country Names and Codes
cessda:CountryNamesAndCodes.v2.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes and names.

cessda.TopicClassification.name: CESSDA Topic Classification
cessda.TopicClassification.description: A typology of main themes or subjects of data.

cessda:TopicClassification.v2.name: CESSDA Topic Classification
cessda:TopicClassification.v2.description: A typology of main themes or subjects of data.

cessda.AggregationMethod.name: Aggregation Method
cessda.AggregationMethod.description: Identifies the type of aggregation used to combine related categories, usually within a common branch of a hierarchy, to provide information at a broader level than the level at which detailed observations are taken. (From: The OECD Glossary of Statistical Terms)

cessda.AnalysisUnit.name: Analysis Unit
cessda.AnalysisUnit.description: Describes the entity being analyzed in the study or variable. This vocabulary can also be used to describe the unit of observation, which is the unit being observed, or from which data are collected. The unit of observation can be the same as, or different from the unit of analysis.

cessda.CharacterSet.name: Character Set
cessda.CharacterSet.description: Standard set of characters upon which many character encodings are based (Wikipedia).

cessda.CommonalityType.name: Commonality Type
cessda.CommonalityType.description: Describes the degree of similarity between two items or schemes (collections of items).

cessda.DataSourceType.name: Data Source Type
cessda.DataSourceType.description: Includes a typology of data sources.

cessda.DataType.name: Data Type
cessda.DataType.description: Identifies the type of data, which has a bearing on the acceptable data values, the operations that can be performed with the data, and the ways in which the data are stored.

cessda.GeneralDataFormat.name: General Data Format
cessda.GeneralDataFormat.description: Describes the physical format(s) of the data documented in the logical product(s) of a study unit.

cessda.LanguageProficiency.name: Language Proficiency
cessda.LanguageProficiency.description: Describes the level of proficiency of an individual in a natural language.

cessda.LifecycleEventType.name: Lifecycle Event Type
cessda.LifecycleEventType.description: Specifies the event happening over the data life cycle that is considered significant enough to document.

cessda.ModeOfCollection.name: Mode Of Collection
cessda.ModeOfCollection.description: The procedure, technique, or mode of inquiry used to attain the data.

cessda.NumericType.name: Numeric Type
cessda.NumericType.description: Specifies the type of numeric data.

cessda.ResponseUnit.name: Response Unit
cessda.ResponseUnit.description: Indicates the entity that provided the information carried by the variable.

cessda.SoftwarePackage.name: Software Package
cessda.SoftwarePackage.description: Indicates the statistical software package used in the production/processing/dissemination of the data. Data collection software is not covered in this list.

cessda.SummaryStatisticType.name: Summary Statistic Type
cessda.SummaryStatisticType.description: Specifies the type of summary statistic. Summary statistics are a single number representation of the characteristics of a set of values.

cessda.TimeMethod.name: Time Method
cessda.TimeMethod.description: Describes the time dimension of the data collection.

cessda.TimeZone.name: Time Zone
cessda.TimeZone.description: Time zone specification as an offset from UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) in terms of hours and minutes.

cessda.TypeOfAddress.name: Type of Address
cessda.TypeOfAddress.description: Identifies the type of address entered as contact information for an individual or an organization.

cessda.TypeOfConceptGroup.name: Type of Concept Group
cessda.TypeOfConceptGroup.description: Specifies the rationale for creating a concept group.

cessda.TypeOfFrequency.name: Type of Frequency
cessda.TypeOfFrequency.description: Indicates the frequency of data collection events.

cessda.TypeOfInstrument.name: Type of Instrument
cessda.TypeOfInstrument.description: Includes a typology of data collection instruments.

cessda.TypeOfTelephone.name: Type of Telephone
cessda.TypeOfTelephone.description: Identifies the type of telephone entered as contact information for an individual or an organization.

cessda.TypeOfTranslationMethod.name: Type of Translation Method
cessda.TypeOfTranslationMethod.description: A typology of methods used to translate data collection instruments, including questionnaires, individual questions, measurements, data capture flows, etc.

cessda.KategorienschemaWahlstudien.name: Category Scheme Election Studies
cessda.KategorienschemaWahlstudien.description: The Category Scheme Election Studies provides the ability to categorize election studies at the question and/or variable level.

cessda.Variables-Relations.name: Variables relations for Social Sciences research data
cessda.Variables-Relations.description: As the variable is one of the most relevant entities to enhance data reuse in the Social Sciences, we provide a framework design to better semantics the variables' relations descriptions. These explicit relations between variables enable comparability and facilitate harmonization across waves. We provide a brief textual identification of the relation type, supported by a controlled vocabulary (CV) and an extended description of the relationship. These relations within variables include but are not limited to different versions, derived formats in new waves, new labels and name wording, and alternative response schema through questionnaires and surveys. For instance, a given variable label is changed from one wave to another, even though its concept remains the same. Their values also are subject to change, such as new cardinalities settings, their categorization, or response scheme and scale measurement. They change based on different conditions, e.g., values are updated by any constraints or modified to comply with the study evolution requirements or a new sociological approach. In the Social Sciences, Economics, and Behaviour Sciences, which investigate, for instance, the social structure of the population, political attitudes of voters and candidates, opinions on family, work, religion, politics and society or competencies of adults, those topics are highly subject to change to fit the empirical reality in a constantly changing world. Thus, we propose widening relations descriptions for Social Sciences variables within datasets beginning from the BasedOnObjectType DDI as a first approach.

cessda.rexconcepts.name: Central concepts of R|EX research
cessda.rexconcepts.description: This CV, developed within the framework of the DP-R|EX joint project, maps the central concepts and theoretical approaches in research on racism and right-wing extremism. The compilation is based on a systematic evaluation of the relevant national and international empirical research literature. The CV equally takes into account the different thematic (racism, right-wing extremism, discrimination) as well as methodological (qualitative research, standardised surveys, data from social media and messaging services) research strands.
